qas.question: What's the party's take on Muslim history?

answers.text: Islam's pivotal turning point as occurring not with the death of Ali

qas.question: When did the four rightly guided Caliphs die?
When was the Ottoman Caliphate abolished?
The abolition of the Ottoman Caliphate is believed to have ended what system?
What are colonial powers blamed for?

answers.text: working through Turkish modernist Mustafa Kemal Atatürk

qas.question: What's the party's take on Muslim present?
When did the five rightly guided Caliphs die?
When was the Ottoman Caliphate maintained?
The abolition of the Ottoman Caliphate is believed to have started what system?
What are colonial powers praised for?

context: In its focus on the Caliphate, the party takes <a0_0>a <a0_2><b5_0>different view<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_0/> of Muslim history than some other Islamists such as Muhammad Qutb. HT sees <a0_1>Islam's pivotal turning point as occurring not with the death of Ali<a0_1/>, or one of the other four rightly guided Caliphs in <a1_1>the <a1_0><a1_2><b6_0>7th century<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, but with the <a4_2>abolition of the Ottoman Caliphate<a4_2/> in <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>1924<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/>. This is believed to have <a4_0><b9_0>ended <a3_1>the <a3_0><a3_2><b8_0>true Islamic<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_0/> system<b9_0/><a4_0/><a3_1/>, something for which it blames "the disbelieving (Kafir) colonial powers" <a4_1>working through Turkish modernist Mustafa Kemal Atatürk<a4_1/>.
